tools.name: Watermark Software
tools.jt_what: Simple batch watermarking to protect your photos with a watermark. Quick and fail proof.
tools.jt_why: Protecting your work from copyright infringement and content theft.

tools.name: TinEye
tools.jt_what: Reverse image search. Good for fact-checking photos.
tools.jt_why: Find out if and where your images have been used.

tools.name: Photoshop Express
tools.jt_what: All the necessaries for photo editing, but mobile and tablet friendly.
tools.jt_why: When you don't have time to edit from your desk.

tools.name: Thematic
tools.jt_what: Responsive, free storytelling platform to showcase your images in high res.
tools.jt_why: Classier than Flickr and easier than making your own website.

tools.name: Storehouse
tools.jt_what: Easy to use storytelling platform that combines typography, photos, video clips, and music.
tools.jt_why: An immersive editor similar to Medium, but for the visually minded.

tools.name: Dronestagram
tools.jt_what: Like Instagram, but for Drone footage.
tools.jt_why: A place to show other aerial enthusiasts what your drone has been up to.

tools.name: World Fixer
tools.jt_what: Not a photography specific app - but one that connects photographers and fixers abroad.
tools.jt_why: Facilitates the connections needed to get shooting a story that you otherwise wouldn't have been able to have access to.

tools.name: The Photographer's Ephemeris
tools.jt_what: A map-centric sun and moon calculator that shows lighting conditions, day or night, for any location on earth.
tools.jt_why: Eliminates the guess work out of lighting conditions.

tools.name: Photo Find
tools.jt_what: A compass for your geo-tagged photos.
tools.jt_why: Never question "where was that picture taken?" again.

tools.name: Compressor
tools.jt_what: A web-based tool to compress large images without losing quality.
tools.jt_why: Because sending many high res files is often unnecessary.
